column4: i guess i'll have to look in the kernel and see if there is something in there
if i hit Alt+F2, what should i type to bring up the Terminal?
it is in universe, do you have the universe repo enabled
it doesn't return anything, just goes back to the prompt
run this, sudo sed 's/# deb/deb/g' -i.backup /etc/apt/sources.list && sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install deluge-torrent
thanks, that worked, but do you happen to know why the universe repository didn't actually load when i enabled it through the Synaptic Package manager?
because it was commented out, look back at your paste, line 16 and 17, anything that has a # in front of it is commented out and won't be read
yeah, i noticed that it was commented out in the sources.list; does that mean the synaptic package manager doesn't have permission or the capabilities to uncomment that file?
you have to set it to do it in preferences or something. I am not sure exactly where you do that, But you have to configure synaptic to uncomment it.
if you don't mind me asking is the synaptic package manager just a gui for apt-get? if so, how - or is it - related to aptitude?
I don't know if synaptic uses apt-get or aptitude, it is a frontend for one of them
